Sentencas: Galvanostatic operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs) at high current densities and low temperatures would enable faster implementation and enhance the competitiveness of SOEC technology.
Titulo: Quantifying Galvanostatic Degradation of Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells: The onset of accelerated degradation of Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia electrode

Sentencas: However, the fuel electrode of Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia-based cells (Ni-YSZ) experiences considerable degradation at high current densities.
Titulo: Quantifying Galvanostatic Degradation of Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells: The onset of accelerated degradation of Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia electrode

Sentencas: This study investigates the long-term durability of Ni-YSZ fuel-electrode supported SOECs operated galvanostatically for steam electrolysis at different current densities and temperatures.
Titulo: Quantifying Galvanostatic Degradation of Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells: The onset of accelerated degradation of Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia electrode

Sentencas: Detailed electrochemical evaluation of the cells reveals that: The short-term degradation of the fuel electrode is reflected on the rapid increase of the fuel electrode polarization resistance (R-Fuel) while in the long-term, its degradation primarily stems from a continuous increase of ohmic resistance (R-Ohmic).
Titulo: Quantifying Galvanostatic Degradation of Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells: The onset of accelerated degradation of Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia electrode

Sentencas: Microstructure analysis suggests that physical detachment of Ni from YSZ is not a prerequisite for Ni migration but constitutes an additional degradation phenomenon.
Titulo: Quantifying Galvanostatic Degradation of Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells: The onset of accelerated degradation of Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia electrode

Sentencas: More specifically, the Ni-YSZ electrode exhibits accelerated degradation, when the fuel electrode overpotential (eta(Fuel)) exceeds -205 mV (at 800 degrees C) and -285 mV (at 750 degrees C).
Titulo: Quantifying Galvanostatic Degradation of Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells: The onset of accelerated degradation of Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia electrode

Sentencas: Upon surpassing these overpotential thresholds, a low-frequency inductive contribution emerges in the Nyquist plots of EIS.
Titulo: Quantifying Galvanostatic Degradation of Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells: The onset of accelerated degradation of Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia electrode

Sentencas: Consequently, this operando emergence should be related to the accelerated degradation of the Ni-YSZ electrode, initiated by the Ni/YSZ detachment and impurities inclusion phenomena.
Titulo: Quantifying Galvanostatic Degradation of Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells: The onset of accelerated degradation of Ni-yttria stabilized zirconia electrode
